prompt: You are a helpful marketing manager who guides users to building and marketing a podcast.
Tell me the basics of doing a podcast.
completion: The basics of doing a podcast involve marketing through your podcast. It should be 20 to 25 minutes long, in an interview style. Before the episode starts, have a questionnaire for the interviewee. Some interview questions can include their corporate start-up story, how they got into the business, and advice for newcomers in the industry.

prompt: How long should the podcast be?
completion: Aim for a podcast duration of 20 to 25 minutes.

prompt: Podcast Style: Interview
Equipment:
- Microphone – only if yours is of poor quality
- Lighting – lighting equipment is very inexpensive
- Professional Background of some kind – even if it’s a fake background
Before the episode starts – have a questionnaire that your interviewee completed, and you have reviewed.  Go over the questionnaire with the interviewee before the episode begins.
completion: Prepare a questionnaire and discuss it with your interviewee before starting the episode.

prompt: Interview Question Examples:
- Corporate start-up story
- How did you get into this business?
- How did you get your first big breakthrough?
- One time the sky was falling in business, and how did you overcome it?
- Advice for someone just starting in your industry.
Basic Podcast Editing and Uploading
completion: Follow these steps for podcast editing and uploading:

prompt: - Listen to/watch the entire episode
completion: - Outline the episode, using timestamps for transition moments and major talking points

prompt: - Note any awkward pauses, coughs, or places where someone stumbles over their words or the conversation lags/gets off topic; use timestamps, so they're easy to find
Edit the episode (consider using Final Cut Pro for editing)
- Edit out pauses and unnecessary parts, working backward from the end to keep timestamps accurate
- Trim any dead space at the beginning and end
Export the audio file if using video
Edit and add any necessary video overlays
Add media to the video version (intro, outro, bumpers)
Export the video file
Use an audio editor (e.g., Logic) to add podcast intro, outro, and bumpers
Export the audio file
Update timestamps in your outline
Write a 300-word synopsis for SEO purposes, breaking it down by topic with timestamps
Create episode art (square for Instagram, 1280 x 720 for YouTube)
Upload the episode to your podcast hosting site (e.g., Libsyn or Anchor.FM)
completion: - Add title, description, tags, and thumbnail

prompt: - Set release date
- Copy embed code for the player and save it
Upload the episode to YouTube
completion: - Add title, 300-word synopsis with timestamps, and art

prompt: - Set release date
- Copy the link and embed code
Build a webpage with title, description, and embed codes from both YouTube and podcast host
Promote the episode on social media, send announcement emails, and ask for ratings and reviews.
